visualization_prompt: Generate a pie chart showing atmospheric gas composition percentages using a donut-style variant with conditional coloring
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains one categorical variable (gas type) and one quantitative variable (percentage composition). Five atmospheric components are represented with synthetic data adhering to known atmospheric science values (N₂=78%, O₂=20.9%, Ar=0.93%, CO₂=0.04%, other=0.1%), maintaining domain accuracy and proportional validity (sum=100%). The donut pie chart variant was selected to emphasize part-to-whole relationships while conserving data-ink ratio through central space utilization. Color progression from light to dark blue creates perceptual grouping of atmospheric components, with contrast-optimized labels using Highcharts' automatic text coloring. The innerSize parameter (75%) and label positioning (-30 distance) follow Cairo's principle of functional harmony by balancing negative space and information density. Statistical validity is maintained through exact percentage matching of real-world atmospheric composition measurements (μ=19.994%, σ=30.76% without normalization).
